content:
pnkfelix said:

  • Finalized FCPs (disposition merge)
    • "Tracking Issue for IntoInnerError::into_parts etc. (io_into_inner_error_parts)" rust#79704
    • "Remove P: Unpin bound on impl Future for Pin" rust#81363
    • "Allow leading pipe in matches!() patterns." rust#85272
    • "Stabilize const_fn_transmute, const_fn_union" rust#85769
    • "Partially stabilize const_slice_first_last" rust#86593
    • "Document iteration order of retain functions" rust#86790

@apiraino that first FCP is from T-libs, right? I thought they were discussion their own FCPs now that libs-impl isn't a thing?
oh ok, I thought that FCP/MCP section was meant to give an overview also for other teams. I'll then remove them from the search filter :thumbs_up:
well, you should probably ask some other people in #t-compiler then
but if you want to include all the teams you need a much more broad search, e.g. cargo for sure has MCPs
hm I should start by undertanding what people are interested to see there and _then_ what to do , right?
yeah, I would check in with some members of T-compiler. But my personal preference would be to only show things from T-compiler.
@pnkfelix @Wesley Wiser do you agree if I remove all teams but T-compiler from the FCP/MCP in the meeting's agenda? Are we interested in having at a glance other teams proposals in progress?
I don't feel strongly either way but if it's confusing to have them their for others, I don't mind removing them.
